              class << self

                @application = @app_class = nil

                def groups(*groups)

              def generate_class_tree_level(classes, visited = {})
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                # Only process core extensions on the first visit and remove
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                # Active Storage duplicated classes that are at the top level
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                # since they aren't nested under a definition of the `ActiveStorage` module.
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                if visited.empty?
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  classes = classes.reject { |klass| active_storage?(klass) }
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                  core_exts = classes.extract! { |klass| core_extension?(klass) }
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

            
          
      17.

                  super.unshift([ "Core extensions", "", "", build_core_ext_subtree(core_exts, visited) ])
          
      18.

      21.

              end
          
      22.

              private

                def build_core_ext_subtree(classes, visited)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  classes.map do |klass|
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                    [ klass.name, klass.document_self_or_methods ? klass.path : "", "",
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                        generate_class_tree_level(klass.classes_and_modules, visited) ]
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

            
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                def core_extension?(klass)
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  klass.name != "ActiveSupport" && klass.in_files.any? { |file| file.absolute_name.include?("core_ext") }
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

            
          
      35.

                def active_storage?(klass)
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  klass.name != "ActiveStorage" && klass.in_files.all? { |file| file.absolute_name.include?("active_storage") }
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                end

                class EdgeTask < RepoTask

                class StableTask < RepoTask

                  def rails_version

    lib/rails/app_loader.rb

    53 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 53 lines missed.

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

            require "pathname"
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            require "rails/version"
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

            
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

            module Rails
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              module AppLoader # :nodoc:
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                extend self
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

            
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                RUBY = Gem.ruby
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                EXECUTABLES = ["bin/rails", "script/rails"]
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                BUNDLER_WARNING = <<EOS
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

            Beginning in Rails 4, Rails ships with a `rails` binstub at ./bin/rails that
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

            should be used instead of the Bundler-generated `rails` binstub.
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

            
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

            If you are seeing this message, your binstub at ./bin/rails was generated by
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

            Bundler instead of Rails.
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

            
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

            You might need to regenerate your `rails` binstub locally and add it to source
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

            control:
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

            
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

             rails app:update:bin           # Bear in mind this generates other binstubs
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                                            # too that you may or may not want (like yarn)
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

            
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

            If you already have Rails binstubs in source control, you might be
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

            inadvertently overwriting them during deployment by using bundle install
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

            with the --binstubs option.
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

            If your application was created prior to Rails 4, here's how to upgrade:
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

            
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              bundle config --delete bin    # Turn off Bundler's stub generator
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              rails app:update:bin          # Use the new Rails executables
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

              git add bin                   # Add bin/ to source control
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

            
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            You may need to remove bin/ from your .gitignore as well.
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

            
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

            When you install a gem whose executable you want to use in your app,
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

            generate it and add it to source control:
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

              bundle binstubs some-gem-name
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              git add bin/new-executable
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

            
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

            EOS
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

            
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                def exec_app
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  original_cwd = Dir.pwd
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

            
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  loop do
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                    if exe = find_executable
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                      contents = File.read(exe)
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                      if /(APP|ENGINE)_PATH/.match?(contents)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                        exec RUBY, exe, *ARGV
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                        break # non reachable, hack to be able to stub exec in the test suite
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                      elsif exe.end_with?("bin/rails") && contents.include?("This file was generated by Bundler")
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                        $stderr.puts(BUNDLER_WARNING)
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                        Object.const_set(:APP_PATH, File.expand_path("config/application", Dir.pwd))
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                        require File.expand_path("../boot", APP_PATH)
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                        require "rails/commands"
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                        break
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

            
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                    # If we exhaust the search there is no executable, this could be a
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                    # call to generate a new application, so restore the original cwd.
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                    Dir.chdir(original_cwd) && return if Pathname.new(Dir.pwd).root?
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                    # Otherwise keep moving upwards in search of an executable.
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                    Dir.chdir("..")
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

            
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                def find_executable
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  EXECUTABLES.find { |exe| File.file?(exe) }
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      78.

                  def invoke_from_app_generator(method)

    10.

                  def app_generator
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                    @app_generator ||= begin
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                      gen = Rails::Generators::AppGenerator.new ["rails"], generator_options, destination_root: Rails.root
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                      File.exist?(Rails.root.join("config", "application.rb")) ? gen.send(:app_const) : gen.send(:valid_const?)
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                      gen

                    def generator_options
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                      options = { api: !!Rails.application.config.api_only, update: true }
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_javascript] = !File.exist?(Rails.root.join("bin", "yarn"))
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_active_record]  = !defined?(ActiveRecord::Railtie)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_active_storage] = !defined?(ActiveStorage::Engine) || !defined?(ActiveRecord::Railtie)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_action_mailer]  = !defined?(ActionMailer::Railtie)
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_action_cable]   = !defined?(ActionCable::Engine)
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_sprockets]      = !defined?(Sprockets::Railtie)
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_puma]           = !defined?(Puma)
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_bootsnap]       = !defined?(Bootsnap)
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                      options[:skip_spring]         = !defined?(Spring)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33.

              # An Engine with the responsibility of coordinating the whole boot process.
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17.

              # == Initialization
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              # Rails::Application is responsible for executing all railties and engines
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

              # initializers. It also executes some bootstrap initializers (check
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              # Rails::Application::Bootstrap) and finishing initializers, after all the others
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              # are executed (check Rails::Application::Finisher).
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              # == Configuration
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              # Besides providing the same configuration as Rails::Engine and Rails::Railtie,
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              # the application object has several specific configurations, for example
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

              # "cache_classes", "consider_all_requests_local", "filter_parameters",
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              # "logger" and so forth.
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              # Check Rails::Application::Configuration to see them all.
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33.

      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              # == Routes
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

              # The application object is also responsible for holding the routes and reloading routes
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

              # whenever the files change in development.
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38.

              # == Middlewares
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              # The Application is also responsible for building the middleware stack.
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              # == Booting process
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

              # The application is also responsible for setting up and executing the booting
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

              # process. From the moment you require "config/application.rb" in your app,
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

              # the booting process goes like this:
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

              #   1)  require "config/boot.rb" to set up load paths
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              #   2)  require railties and engines
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

              #   3)  Define Rails.application as "class MyApp::Application < Rails::Application"
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              #   4)  Run config.before_configuration callbacks
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

              #   5)  Load config/environments/ENV.rb
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              #   6)  Run config.before_initialize callbacks
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              #   7)  Run Railtie#initializer defined by railties, engines and application.
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

              #       One by one, each engine sets up its load paths, routes and runs its config/initializers/* files.
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

              #   8)  Custom Railtie#initializers added by railties, engines and applications are executed
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              #   9)  Build the middleware stack and run to_prepare callbacks
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

              #   10) Run config.before_eager_load and eager_load! if eager_load is true
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

              #   11) Run config.after_initialize callbacks
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

              # == Multiple Applications
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              # If you decide to define multiple applications, then the first application
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

              # that is initialized will be set to +Rails.application+, unless you override
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

              # it with a different application.
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

              # To create a new application, you can instantiate a new instance of a class
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

              # that has already been created:
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

              #   class Application < Rails::Application
          
      72.

              #   end
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      74.

              #   first_application  = Application.new
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

              #   second_application = Application.new(config: first_application.config)
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

              # In the above example, the configuration from the first application was used
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

              # to initialize the second application. You can also use the +initialize_copy+
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

              # on one of the applications to create a copy of the application which shares
          
      80.

              # the configuration.
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

              # If you decide to define Rake tasks, runners, or initializers in an
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

              # application other than +Rails.application+, then you must run them manually.
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84.

                def run_load_hooks! # :nodoc:
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  return self if @ran_load_hooks
          
      156.

                  @ran_load_hooks = true
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

            
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  @initial_variable_values.each do |variable_name, value|
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                    if INITIAL_VARIABLES.include?(variable_name)
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                      instance_variable_set("@#{variable_name}", value)
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  instance_eval(&@block) if @block
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  self
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

            
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                # Reload application routes regardless if they changed or not.
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                def reload_routes!
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  routes_reloader.reload!
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

            
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                # Returns the application's KeyGenerator
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                def key_generator
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  # number of iterations selected based on consultation with the google security
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  # team. Details at https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/6952#issuecomment-7661220
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  @caching_key_generator ||= ActiveSupport::CachingKeyGenerator.new(
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                    ActiveSupport::KeyGenerator.new(secret_key_base, iterations: 1000)
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  )
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

            
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a message verifier object.
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                # This verifier can be used to generate and verify signed messages in the application.
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                # It is recommended not to use the same verifier for different things, so you can get different
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                # verifiers passing the +verifier_name+ argument.
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Parameters
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                # * +verifier_name+ - the name of the message verifier.
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Examples
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                #     message = Rails.application.message_verifier('sensitive_data').generate('my sensible data')
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                #     Rails.application.message_verifier('sensitive_data').verify(message)
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                #     # => 'my sensible data'
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                # See the +ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier+ documentation for more information.
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                def message_verifier(verifier_name)
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                  @message_verifiers[verifier_name] ||= begin
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                    secret = key_generator.generate_key(verifier_name.to_s)
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                    ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier.new(secret)
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

            
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                # Convenience for loading config/foo.yml for the current Rails env.
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                # Examples:
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                #     # config/exception_notification.yml:
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                #     production:
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                #       url: http://127.0.0.1:8080
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                #       namespace: my_app_production
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                #     development:
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                #       url: http://localhost:3001
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                #       namespace: my_app_development
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                #     # config/environments/production.rb
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                #     Rails.application.configure do
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                #       config.middleware.use ExceptionNotifier, config_for(:exception_notification)
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                #     end
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                #     # You can also store configurations in a shared section which will be
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                #     # merged with the environment configuration
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                #     # config/example.yml
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                #     shared:
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                #       foo:
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                #         bar:
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                #           baz: 1
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

                #     development:
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                #       foo:
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                #         bar:
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                #           qux: 2
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                #     # development environment
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                #     Rails.application.config_for(:example)[:foo][:bar]
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                #     # => { baz: 1, qux: 2 }
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                def config_for(name, env: Rails.env)
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  yaml = name.is_a?(Pathname) ? name : Pathname.new("#{paths["config"].existent.first}/#{name}.yml")
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

            
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  if yaml.exist?
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                    require "erb"
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                    all_configs    = ActiveSupport::ConfigurationFile.parse(yaml, symbolize_names: true)
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                    config, shared = all_configs[env.to_sym], all_configs[:shared]
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

            
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                    if config.is_a?(Hash)
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                      ActiveSupport::OrderedOptions.new.update(shared&.deep_merge(config) || config)
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                      config || shared
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                    raise "Could not load configuration. No such file - #{yaml}"
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

            
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                # Stores some of the Rails initial environment parameters which
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                # will be used by middlewares and engines to configure themselves.
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                def env_config
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                  @app_env_config ||= begin
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                    super.merge(
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.parameter_filter" => config.filter_parameters,
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.redirect_filter" => config.filter_redirect,
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.secret_key_base" => secret_key_base,
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.show_exceptions" => config.action_dispatch.show_exceptions,
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.show_detailed_exceptions" => config.consider_all_requests_local,
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.logger" => Rails.logger,
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.backtrace_cleaner" => Rails.backtrace_cleaner,
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.key_generator" => key_generator,
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.http_auth_salt" => config.action_dispatch.http_auth_salt,
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.signed_cookie_salt" => config.action_dispatch.signed_cookie_salt,
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.encrypted_cookie_salt" => config.action_dispatch.encrypted_cookie_salt,
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.encrypted_signed_cookie_salt" => config.action_dispatch.encrypted_signed_cookie_salt,
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.authenticated_encrypted_cookie_salt" => config.action_dispatch.authenticated_encrypted_cookie_salt,
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.use_authenticated_cookie_encryption" => config.action_dispatch.use_authenticated_cookie_encryption,
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.encrypted_cookie_cipher" => config.action_dispatch.encrypted_cookie_cipher,
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.signed_cookie_digest" => config.action_dispatch.signed_cookie_digest,
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.cookies_serializer" => config.action_dispatch.cookies_serializer,
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.cookies_digest" => config.action_dispatch.cookies_digest,
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.cookies_rotations" => config.action_dispatch.cookies_rotations,
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.cookies_same_site_protection" => config.action_dispatch.cookies_same_site_protection,
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.use_cookies_with_metadata" => config.action_dispatch.use_cookies_with_metadata,
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.content_security_policy" => config.content_security_policy,
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.content_security_policy_report_only" => config.content_security_policy_report_only,
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.content_security_policy_nonce_generator" => config.content_security_policy_nonce_generator,
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.content_security_policy_nonce_directives" => config.content_security_policy_nonce_directives,
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                      "action_dispatch.feature_policy" => config.feature_policy,
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                    )
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

            
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

                # If you try to define a set of Rake tasks on the instance, these will get
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

                # passed up to the Rake tasks defined on the application's class.
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                def rake_tasks(&block)
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  self.class.rake_tasks(&block)
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

            
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                # Sends the initializers to the +initializer+ method defined in the
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

                # Rails::Initializable module. Each Rails::Application class has its own
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

                # set of initializers, as defined by the Initializable module.
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

                def initializer(name, opts = {}, &block)
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

                  self.class.initializer(name, opts, &block)
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

            
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                # Sends any runner called in the instance of a new application up
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                # to the +runner+ method defined in Rails::Railtie.
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                def runner(&blk)
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                  self.class.runner(&blk)
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

            
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                # Sends any console called in the instance of a new application up
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

                # to the +console+ method defined in Rails::Railtie.
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

                def console(&blk)
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                  self.class.console(&blk)
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

            
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

                # Sends any generators called in the instance of a new application up
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                # to the +generators+ method defined in Rails::Railtie.
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                def generators(&blk)
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

                  self.class.generators(&blk)
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

            
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

                # Sends the +isolate_namespace+ method up to the class method.
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

                def isolate_namespace(mod)
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

                  self.class.isolate_namespace(mod)
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

            
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

                ## Rails internal API
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

            
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

                # This method is called just after an application inherits from Rails::Application,
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

                # allowing the developer to load classes in lib and use them during application
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            
            

            

                # configuration.
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

                #   class MyApplication < Rails::Application
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

                #     require "my_backend" # in lib/my_backend
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

                #     config.i18n.backend = MyBackend
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                #   end
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

                # Notice this method takes into consideration the default root path. So if you
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

                # are changing config.root inside your application definition or having a custom
          
      344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    344. 
            
            

            

                # Rails application, you will need to add lib to $LOAD_PATH on your own in case
          
      345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    345. 
            
            

            

                # you need to load files in lib/ during the application configuration as well.
          
      346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    346. 
            
            

            

                def self.add_lib_to_load_path!(root) #:nodoc:
          
      347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    347. 
            
            

            

                  path = File.join root, "lib"
          
      348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    348. 
            
            

            

                  if File.exist?(path) && !$LOAD_PATH.include?(path)
          
      349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    349. 
            
            

            

                    $LOAD_PATH.unshift(path)
          
      350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    350. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    352. 
            
            

            

            
          
      353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    353. 
            
            

            

                def require_environment! #:nodoc:
          
      354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    354. 
            
            

            

                  environment = paths["config/environment"].existent.first
          
      355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    355. 
            
            

            

                  require environment if environment
          
      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    357. 
            
            

            

            
          
      358.

                def routes_reloader #:nodoc:
          
      359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    359. 
            
            

            

                  @routes_reloader ||= RoutesReloader.new
          
      360.

                end
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

            
          
      362.

                # Returns an array of file paths appended with a hash of
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

                # directories-extensions suitable for ActiveSupport::FileUpdateChecker
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

                # API.
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                def watchable_args #:nodoc:
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

                  files, dirs = config.watchable_files.dup, config.watchable_dirs.dup
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

            
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                  ActiveSupport::Dependencies.autoload_paths.each do |path|
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                    File.file?(path) ? files << path.to_s : dirs[path.to_s] = [:rb]
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

            
          
      372.

                  [files, dirs]

    373. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

            
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

                # Initialize the application passing the given group. By default, the
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                # group is :default
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

                def initialize!(group = :default) #:nodoc:
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                  raise "Application has been already initialized." if @initialized
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                  run_initializers(group, self)
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                  @initialized = true
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                  self
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

            
          
      384.

                def initializers #:nodoc:

                  Bootstrap.initializers_for(self) +
          
      386.

                  railties_initializers(super) +
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                  Finisher.initializers_for(self)
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

            
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                def config #:nodoc:
          
      391.

                  @config ||= Application::Configuration.new(self.class.find_root(self.class.called_from))
          
      392.

                end
          
      393.

                attr_writer :config
