            1
            

            

                def assets_manifest
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  template "rails/engine_manifest.js", "app/assets/config/#{underscored_name}_manifest.js"
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            1
            

            

                def stylesheets
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  if mountable?
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                    copy_file "rails/stylesheets.css",
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                              "app/assets/stylesheets/#{namespaced_name}/application.css"
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  elsif full?
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                    empty_directory_with_keep_file "app/assets/stylesheets/#{namespaced_name}"
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

            
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            1
            

            

                def bin(force = false)
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  bin_file = engine? ? "bin/rails.tt" : "bin/test.tt"
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  template bin_file, force: force do |content|
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                    "#{shebang}\n" + content
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  chmod "bin", 0755, verbose: false
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

            
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            1
            

            

                def gemfile_entry
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  return unless inside_application?
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

            
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  gemfile_in_app_path = File.join(rails_app_path, "Gemfile")
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  if File.exist? gemfile_in_app_path
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                    entry = "\ngem '#{name}', path: '#{relative_path}'"
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                    append_file gemfile_in_app_path, entry
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

            
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            1
            

            

              module Generators
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            1
            

            

                class PluginGenerator < AppBase # :nodoc:
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            1
            

            

                  add_shared_options_for "plugin"
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

            
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            1
            

            

                  alias_method :plugin_path, :app_path
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

            
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            1
            

            

                  class_option :dummy_path,   type: :string, default: "test/dummy",
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                                              desc: "Create dummy application at given path"
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

            
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            1
            

            

                  class_option :full,         type: :boolean, default: false,
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                                              desc: "Generate a rails engine with bundled Rails application for testing"
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

            
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            1
            

            

                  class_option :mountable,    type: :boolean, default: false,
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                                              desc: "Generate mountable isolated engine"
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

            
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            1
            

            

                  class_option :skip_gemspec, type: :boolean, default: false,
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                                              desc: "Skip gemspec file"
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

            
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            1
            

            

                  class_option :skip_gemfile_entry, type: :boolean, default: false,
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                                                    desc: "If creating plugin in application's directory " \
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                                                             "skip adding entry to Gemfile"
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

            
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            1
            

            

                  class_option :api,          type: :boolean, default: false,
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                                              desc: "Generate a smaller stack for API application plugins"
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

            
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            1
            

            

                  def initialize(*args)
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                    @dummy_path = nil
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                    super
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

            
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            1
            

            

                  public_task :set_default_accessors!
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            1
            

            

                  public_task :create_root
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

            
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            1
            

            

                  def create_root_files
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                    build(:readme)
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                    build(:rakefile)
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                    build(:gemspec)   unless options[:skip_gemspec]
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                    build(:license)
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                    build(:gitignore) unless options[:skip_git]
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                    build(:gemfile)   unless options[:skip_gemfile]
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                    build(:version_control)
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

            
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            1
            

            

                  def create_app_files

                    build(:app)
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

            
          
      226.

            1
            

            

                  def create_config_files

                  end

                  def create_lib_files

            1
            

            

                  def create_assets_manifest_file

                    build(:assets_manifest) if !api? && engine?
          
      236.

                  end
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237.

            1
            

            

                  def create_public_stylesheets_files

                    build(:stylesheets) unless api?
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241.

                  def create_bin_files

                  def create_test_files

                  def create_test_dummy_files
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                    return unless with_dummy_app?
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                    create_dummy_app
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

            
          
      255.

            1
            

            

                  def update_gemfile
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                    build(:gemfile_entry) unless options[:skip_gemfile_entry]
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

            
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            1
            

            

                  def finish_template
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                    build(:leftovers)
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

            
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            1
            

            

                  public_task :apply_rails_template
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

            
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            1
            

            

                  def name
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                    @name ||= begin
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                      # same as ActiveSupport::Inflector#underscore except not replacing '-'
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                      underscored = original_name.dup
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                      underscored.gsub!(/([A-Z]+)([A-Z][a-z])/, '\1_\2')
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                      underscored.gsub!(/([a-z\d])([A-Z])/, '\1_\2')
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                      underscored.downcase!
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

            
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

                      underscored
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

            
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            1
            

            

                  def underscored_name
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                    @underscored_name ||= original_name.underscore
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

            
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            1
            

            

                  def namespaced_name
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

                    @namespaced_name ||= name.tr("-", "/")
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

            
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            1
            

            

                private
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            1
            

            

                  def create_dummy_app(path = nil)
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                    dummy_path(path) if path
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

            
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

                    say_status :vendor_app, dummy_path
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                    mute do
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                      build(:generate_test_dummy)
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                      build(:test_dummy_config)
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

                      build(:test_dummy_assets)
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

                      build(:test_dummy_clean)
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

                      # ensure that bin/rails has proper dummy_path
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

                      build(:bin, true)
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

            
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            1
            

            

                  def engine?
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                    full? || mountable? || options[:engine]
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

            
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            1
            

            

                  def full?
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

                    options[:full]
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

            
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            1
            

            

                  def mountable?
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                    options[:mountable]
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

            
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            1
            

            

                  def skip_git?
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

                    options[:skip_git]
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

            
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            1
            

            

                  def with_dummy_app?
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                    options[:skip_test].blank? || options[:dummy_path] != "test/dummy"
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

            
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            1
            

            

                  def api?
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                    options[:api]
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

            
          
      324.

                  def wrap_in_modules(unwrapped_code)
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

                    unwrapped_code = "#{unwrapped_code}".strip.gsub(/\s$\n/, "")
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

                    modules.reverse.inject(unwrapped_code) do |content, mod|
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

                      str = +"module #{mod}\n"
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                      str << content.lines.map { |line| "  #{line}" }.join
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                      str << (content.present? ? "\nend" : "end")
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

                  end

                  def valid_const?
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                    if /-\d/.match?(original_name)
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

                      raise Error, "Invalid plugin name #{original_name}. Please give a name which does not contain a namespace starting with numeric characters."
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                    elsif /[^\w-]+/.match?(original_name)
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                      raise Error, "Invalid plugin name #{original_name}. Please give a name which uses only alphabetic, numeric, \"_\" or \"-\" characters."
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                    elsif /^\d/.match?(camelized)
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                      raise Error, "Invalid plugin name #{original_name}. Please give a name which does not start with numbers."
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

                    elsif RESERVED_NAMES.include?(name)
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

                      raise Error, "Invalid plugin name #{original_name}. Please give a " \
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                                   "name which does not match one of the reserved rails " \
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                                   "words: #{RESERVED_NAMES.join(", ")}"
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386.

      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                      raise Error, "Invalid plugin name #{original_name}, constant #{camelized} is already in use. Please choose another plugin name."
          
      388.

                    def assert_file(relative, *contents)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                      absolute = File.expand_path(relative, destination_root)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                      assert File.exist?(absolute), "Expected file #{relative.inspect} to exist, but does not"
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                      read = File.read(absolute) if block_given? || !contents.empty?
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                      assert_nothing_raised { yield read } if block_given?
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32.

      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33.

    34.

      35.

      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36.

      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37.

                    def assert_instance_method(method, content)

                    def assert_field_type(attribute_type, field_type)

                    def assert_field_default_value(attribute_type, value)
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                      if value.nil?
          
      119.

                  def to_html

                    (+"<table>").tap do |table|

                      properties.each do |(name, value)|

                        formatted_value = if value.kind_of?(Array)

    49. 
            
            

            

                        else

                          CGI.escapeHTML(value.to_s)
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                        table << %(<td class="value">#{formatted_value}</td></tr>)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                      end

      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                  render action: "mailer"
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  @email_action = File.basename(params[:path])
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

            
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  if @preview.email_exists?(@email_action)
          
      29.

      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                    @email = @preview.call(@email_action, params)
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31.

    32. 
            
            

            

                    if params[:part]
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                      part_type = Mime::Type.lookup(params[:part])
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

            
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                      if part = find_part(part_type)

                        response.content_type = part_type

      40.

            require "pathname"

            module Rails

              module Paths
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                # This object is an extended hash that behaves as root of the <tt>Rails::Paths</tt> system.
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                # It allows you to collect information about how you want to structure your application
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                # paths through a Hash-like API. It requires you to give a physical path on initialization.
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                #   root = Root.new "/rails"
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                #   root.add "app/controllers", eager_load: true
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                # The above command creates a new root object and adds "app/controllers" as a path.
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                # This means we can get a <tt>Rails::Paths::Path</tt> object back like below:
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                #   path = root["app/controllers"]
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                #   path.eager_load?               # => true
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                #   path.is_a?(Rails::Paths::Path) # => true
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                # The +Path+ object is simply an enumerable and allows you to easily add extra paths:
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                #   path.is_a?(Enumerable) # => true
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                #   path.to_ary.inspect    # => ["app/controllers"]
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                #   path << "lib/controllers"
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                #   path.to_ary.inspect    # => ["app/controllers", "lib/controllers"]
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                # Notice that when you add a path using +add+, the path object created already
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                # contains the path with the same path value given to +add+. In some situations,
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                # you may not want this behavior, so you can give <tt>:with</tt> as option.
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                #   root.add "config/routes", with: "config/routes.rb"
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                #   root["config/routes"].inspect # => ["config/routes.rb"]
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                # The +add+ method accepts the following options as arguments:
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                # eager_load, autoload, autoload_once, and glob.
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                # Finally, the +Path+ object also provides a few helpers:
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                #   root = Root.new "/rails"
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                #   root.add "app/controllers"
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                #   root["app/controllers"].expanded # => ["/rails/app/controllers"]

                #   root["app/controllers"].existent # => ["/rails/app/controllers"]
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                # Check the <tt>Rails::Paths::Path</tt> documentation for more information.
          
      48.

                class Root

                  def initialize(path)

                  def []=(path, value)
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                    glob = self[path] ? self[path].glob : nil
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                    add(path, with: value, glob: glob)

                  end

                  def add(path, options = {})
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                    with = Array(options.fetch(:with, path))
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                    @root[path] = Path.new(self, path, with, options)
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  end

                    @root[path]

                private
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  def filter_by(&block)
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                    all_paths.find_all(&block).flat_map { |path|
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                      paths = path.existent
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                      paths - path.children.flat_map { |p| yield(p) ? [] : p.existent }
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                    }.uniq
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                class Path
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  include Enumerable
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

            
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  attr_accessor :glob
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

            
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  def initialize(root, current, paths, options = {})
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                    @paths   = paths
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                    @current = current
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                    @root    = root
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                    @glob    = options[:glob]
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                    @exclude = options[:exclude]
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

            
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                    options[:autoload_once] ? autoload_once! : skip_autoload_once!
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                    options[:eager_load]    ? eager_load!    : skip_eager_load!
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                    options[:autoload]      ? autoload!      : skip_autoload!
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                    options[:load_path]     ? load_path!     : skip_load_path!
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128.

                  def absolute_current # :nodoc:

                  def children

                  %w(autoload_once eager_load autoload load_path).each do |m|

                    class_eval <<-RUBY, __FILE__, __LINE__ + 1

    150. 
            
            

            

                      def #{m}!        # def eager_load!

                  # Expands all paths against the root and return all unique values.

                  def expanded

    199. 
            
            

            

                    raise "You need to set a path root" unless @root.path
          
      200.

                    result = []
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

            
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                    each do |path|

                  # Returns all expanded paths but only if they exist in the filesystem.

                    def files_in(path)
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                      files = Dir.glob(@glob, base: path)
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                      files -= @exclude if @exclude
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                      files.map! { |file| File.join(path, file) }
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                      files.sort
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                end

              end

            end

                # Sets log tags, logs the request, calls the app, and flushes the logs.
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                # Log tags (+taggers+) can be an Array containing: methods that the +request+
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                # object responds to, objects that respond to +to_s+ or Proc objects that accept
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                # an instance of the +request+ object.
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                class Logger < ActiveSupport::LogSubscriber
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  def initialize(app, taggers = nil)
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                    @app          = app
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                    @taggers      = taggers || []
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

            
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  def call(env)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                    request = ActionDispatch::Request.new(env)
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

            
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                    if logger.respond_to?(:tagged)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                      logger.tagged(compute_tags(request)) { call_app(request, env) }
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                      call_app(request, env)
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

            
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  private
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                    def call_app(request, env) # :doc:
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                      instrumenter = ActiveSupport::Notifications.instrumenter
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                      instrumenter.start "request.action_dispatch", request: request
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                      logger.info { started_request_message(request) }
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                      status, headers, body = @app.call(env)
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                      body = ::Rack::BodyProxy.new(body) { finish(request) }
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                      [status, headers, body]
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                    rescue Exception
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                      finish(request)
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                      raise
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                    ensure
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                      ActiveSupport::LogSubscriber.flush_all!
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

            
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                    # Started GET "/session/new" for 127.0.0.1 at 2012-09-26 14:51:42 -0700
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                    def started_request_message(request) # :doc:
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                      'Started %s "%s" for %s at %s' % [
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                        request.request_method,
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                        request.filtered_path,
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                        request.remote_ip,
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                        Time.now.to_default_s ]
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

            
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                    def compute_tags(request) # :doc:
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                      @taggers.collect do |tag|
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                        case tag
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                        when Proc
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                          tag.call(request)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                        when Symbol
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                          request.send(tag)
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                          tag
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

            
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                    def finish(request)
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                      instrumenter = ActiveSupport::Notifications.instrumenter
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                      instrumenter.finish "request.action_dispatch", request: request
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73.

            module Rails
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              # <tt>Rails::Railtie</tt> is the core of the Rails framework and provides
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              # several hooks to extend Rails and/or modify the initialization process.
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

              # Every major component of Rails (Action Mailer, Action Controller, Active
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

              # Record, etc.) implements a railtie. Each of them is responsible for their
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              # own initialization. This makes Rails itself absent of any component hooks,
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

              # allowing other components to be used in place of any of the Rails defaults.
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

              # Developing a Rails extension does _not_ require implementing a railtie, but
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

              # if you need to interact with the Rails framework during or after boot, then
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

              # a railtie is needed.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

              # For example, an extension doing any of the following would need a railtie:
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              # * creating initializers
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              # * configuring a Rails framework for the application, like setting a generator
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              # * adding <tt>config.*</tt> keys to the environment
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              # * setting up a subscriber with <tt>ActiveSupport::Notifications</tt>
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              # * adding Rake tasks
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

              # == Creating a Railtie
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              # To extend Rails using a railtie, create a subclass of <tt>Rails::Railtie</tt>.
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              # This class must be loaded during the Rails boot process, and is conventionally
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

              # called <tt>MyNamespace::Railtie</tt>.
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              # The following example demonstrates an extension which can be used with or
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

              # without Rails.
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

              #   # lib/my_gem/railtie.rb
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

              #   module MyGem
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

              #     class Railtie < Rails::Railtie
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

              #   # lib/my_gem.rb
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

              #   require "my_gem/railtie" if defined?(Rails::Railtie)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46.

              # == Initializers
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

              # To add an initialization step to the Rails boot process from your railtie, just
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              # define the initialization code with the +initializer+ macro:
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              #   class MyRailtie < Rails::Railtie
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

              #     initializer "my_railtie.configure_rails_initialization" do
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              #       # some initialization behavior
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              # If specified, the block can also receive the application object, in case you
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

              # need to access some application-specific configuration, like middleware:
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

              #   class MyRailtie < Rails::Railtie
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

              #     initializer "my_railtie.configure_rails_initialization" do |app|
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

              #       app.middleware.use MyRailtie::Middleware
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      65.

              #   end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

              # Finally, you can also pass <tt>:before</tt> and <tt>:after</tt> as options to
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

              # +initializer+, in case you want to couple it with a specific step in the
          
      69.

              # == Loading Rake Tasks and Generators
          
      88.

              #
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

              # If your railtie has Rake tasks, you can tell Rails to load them through the method
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

              # +rake_tasks+:
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      92.

              #   class MyRailtie < Rails::Railtie
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

              #     rake_tasks do

              #
          
      98.

              # By default, Rails loads generators from your load path. However, if you want to place
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

              # your generators at a different location, you can specify in your railtie a block which
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

              # will load them during normal generators lookup:
          
      101.

              #

              # Since filenames on the load path are shared across gems, be sure that files you load
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

              # through a railtie have unique names.
          
      110.

              # == Application and Engine
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

              # An engine is nothing more than a railtie with some initializers already set. And since
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

              # <tt>Rails::Application</tt> is an engine, the same configuration described here can be
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

              # used in both.
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

              # Be sure to look at the documentation of those specific classes for more information.
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

              class Railtie
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                autoload :Configuration, "rails/railtie/configuration"
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

            
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                include Initializable

    122. 
            
            

            

            
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                ABSTRACT_RAILTIES = %w(Rails::Railtie Rails::Engine Rails::Application)
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

            
          
      125.

                class << self
          
      126.

                  def subclasses

                  def inherited(base)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                    unless base.abstract_railtie?
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                      subclasses << base
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      138.

      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  def rake_tasks(&blk)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                    register_block_for(:rake_tasks, &blk)
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

            
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  def console(&blk)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                    register_block_for(:load_console, &blk)
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146.

                  def runner(&blk)

                    register_block_for(:runner, &blk)

                  end

                  end
