                  def abstract_railtie?
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                    ABSTRACT_RAILTIES.include?(name)
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

            
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  def railtie_name(name = nil)
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                    @railtie_name = name.to_s if name
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                    @railtie_name ||= generate_railtie_name(self.name)
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  # Since Rails::Railtie cannot be instantiated, any methods that call
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  # +instance+ are intended to be called only on subclasses of a Railtie.
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  def instance
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                    @instance ||= new
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

            
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  # Allows you to configure the railtie. This is the same method seen in
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  # Railtie::Configurable, but this module is no longer required for all
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  # subclasses of Railtie so we provide the class method here.
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  def configure(&block)
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                    instance.configure(&block)
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

            
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  private
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                    def generate_railtie_name(string)
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                      ActiveSupport::Inflector.underscore(string).tr("/", "_")
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

            
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                    def respond_to_missing?(name, _)
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                      instance.respond_to?(name) || super
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

            
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                    # If the class method does not have a method, then send the method call
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                    # to the Railtie instance.
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                    def method_missing(name, *args, &block)
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                      if instance.respond_to?(name)
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                        instance.public_send(name, *args, &block)
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                        super
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                    ruby2_keywords(:method_missing) if respond_to?(:ruby2_keywords, true)
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

            
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                    # receives an instance variable identifier, set the variable value if is
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                    # blank and append given block to value, which will be used later in
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                    # `#each_registered_block(type, &block)`
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                    def register_block_for(type, &blk)
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                      var_name = "@#{type}"
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                      blocks = instance_variable_defined?(var_name) ? instance_variable_get(var_name) : instance_variable_set(var_name, [])
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                      blocks << blk if blk
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                      blocks
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      207.

      208.

                private
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  # run `&block` in every registered block in `#register_block_for`
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                  def each_registered_block(type, &block)
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                    klass = self.class
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                    while klass.respond_to?(type)
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                      klass.public_send(type).each(&block)
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                      klass = klass.superclass
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      260.

                  def respond_to?(name, include_private = false)

                  end

                private

                  def method_missing(name, *args, &blk)
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                    if name.end_with?("=")
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                      @@options[:"#{name[0..-2]}"] = args.first
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                    elsif @@options.key?(name)
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                      @@options[name]
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                      super
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  end

    100. 
            
            

            

                end

                    def writing(contents)

    87.

    94. 
            
            

            

            
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95.

              # Implements the logic behind <tt>Rails::Command::NotesCommand</tt>. See <tt>rails notes --help</tt> for usage information.
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

              # Annotation objects are triplets <tt>:line</tt>, <tt>:tag</tt>, <tt>:text</tt> that
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              # represent the line where the annotation lives, its tag, and its text. Note
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              # the filename is not stored.
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

              # Annotations are looked for in comments and modulus whitespace they have to
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

              # start with the tag optionally followed by a colon. Everything up to the end
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              # of the line (or closing ERB comment tag) is considered to be their text.
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            17

                  def self.register_extensions(*exts, &block)

      54.

                  # If +options+ has a flag <tt>:tag</tt> the tag is shown as in the example above.
          
      56.

                  # Otherwise the string contains just line and text.
          
      57.

                  def to_s(options = {})
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                    s = +"[#{line.to_s.rjust(options[:indent])}] "
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                    s << "[#{tag}] " if options[:tag]
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                    s << text

                  def self.notes_task_deprecation_warning

                # +config+, +db+, +lib+, and +test+ (recursively).

                def find(dirs)

                # Returns a hash that maps filenames under +dir+ (recursively) to arrays
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                # with their annotations. Files with extensions registered in

                # <tt>Rails::SourceAnnotationExtractor::Annotation.extensions</tt> are

                def find_in(dir)

    109. 
            
            

            

                  results = {}

                def extract_annotations_from(file, pattern)

                    def load_tests(argv)

                    def compose_filter(runnable, filter)
          
      55.

                      if filters.any? { |_, lines| lines.any? }

                      def extract_filters(argv)
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                        # Extract absolute and relative paths but skip -n /.*/ regexp filters.
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                        argv.select { |arg| path_argument?(arg) && !regexp_filter?(arg) }.map do |path|
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                          path = path.tr("\\", "/")
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                          case
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                          when /(:\d+)+$/.match?(path)
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                            file, *lines = path.split(":")
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                            filters << [ file, lines ]
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                            file
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                          when Dir.exist?(path)
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                            "#{path}/**/*_test.rb"
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                          else
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                            filters << [ path, [] ]
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                            path
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                          end
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78.

      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79.

                      def regexp_filter?(arg)
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                        arg.start_with?("/") && arg.end_with?("/")

                      def path_argument?(arg)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                        %r"^[/\\]?\w+[/\\]".match?(arg)
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

            
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            17
            

            

                class CompositeFilter # :nodoc:
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            17
            

            

                  attr_reader :named_filter
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            17
            

            

                  def initialize(runnable, filter, patterns)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                    @runnable = runnable
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                    @named_filter = derive_named_filter(filter)
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                    @filters = [ @named_filter, *derive_line_filters(patterns) ].compact
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

            
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  # minitest uses === to find matching filters.
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            17
            

            

                  def ===(method)
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                    @filters.any? { |filter| filter === method }
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

            
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            17
            

            

                  private
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            17
            

            

                    def derive_named_filter(filter)
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                      if filter.respond_to?(:named_filter)
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                        filter.named_filter
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                      elsif filter =~ %r%/(.*)/% # Regexp filtering copied from minitest.
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                        Regexp.new $1
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                      elsif filter.is_a?(String)
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                        filter
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

            
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            17
            

            

                    def derive_line_filters(patterns)
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                      patterns.flat_map do |file, lines|
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                        if lines.empty?
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                          Filter.new(@runnable, file, nil) if file
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                          lines.map { |line| Filter.new(@runnable, file, line) }
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

            
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            17
            

            

                class Filter # :nodoc:
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            17
            

            

                  def initialize(runnable, file, line)
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                    @runnable, @file = runnable, File.expand_path(file)
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                    @line = line.to_i if line
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

            
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            17
            

            

                  def ===(method)
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                    return unless @runnable.method_defined?(method)
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

            
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                    if @line
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                      test_file, test_range = definition_for(@runnable.instance_method(method))
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                      test_file == @file && test_range.include?(@line)
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                      @runnable.instance_method(method).source_location.first == @file
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

            
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            17
            

            

                  private
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            17
            

            

                    def definition_for(method)
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                      file, start_line = method.source_location
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                      end_line = method.source.count("\n") + start_line - 1
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                      return file, start_line..end_line
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      162.
